C.DHEERAJ RAJAN OTHER PRESENT: SRI.RAMESH CHAND, PP THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 07.01.2020, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Peete ioe ee a 2020/KER/471 Cr. MC 7356/2019 2 ORDER Dated this the 7th day of January 2020 Petitioners are accused in Crime No.516/2019 of Kaipamangalam Police Station for having allegedly committed offences punishable under Sections 143, 147, 148, 363, 341, 323, 324, 308 and 506 read with Section 149 IPC. 2. The only defacto complainant/injured is the second respondent, who has appeared through counsel and filed affidavit to the effect that the matter has been amicably settled with the petitioners and that he has no grievance against them. A report to that effect has also been obtained from the investigating officer through the learned Public Prosecutor. The injuries Sustained are not life threatening. Even while granting bail to the petitioners, the Sessions Court was apprehensive of whether an offence under Section 308 IPC would be attracted. No public interest is involved. The petitioners do not have any criminal oo = me rin 2020/KER/471 Crl.MC 7356/2019 3 antecedents. In the result, the Criminal M.c. is allowed and the entire proceedings as against the petitioners herein in crime No.516/2019 of Kaipamangalam Police Station shall stand quashed under Section 482 Cr.PC and the petitioners/accused are discharged.
